DESCRIPTION OF # 3 — “CONVERSATIONS ABROAD”,.. .INTERVIEW 1»VITH ITALIAN
HOSTESS AND AMERICAN “COMMUNITY AI4BASSADOR” IN
CUNEO, ITALY
Description of the welcome given the Americans by their host families, the
food they were eating, the preparations and plans made by the Italian residents
for their visitors, and also their concern that the Americans would not be able
to adjust to a less “easy way of life“^ plans for the anticipated trip to the
surrounding countryside in the Piedmonts section of Italy, and the later tour
to Rome, Venice, etc. Also the sounds (recorded) of the churchbells and the
motor scooters, which are almost constant as part of the audible “scenery*' in
Italy. How Miss Randall (the young American Community Ambassador) would try
to interpret American life to Italians, and how she would relate her experi¬
ences and her “learning" when she returned home.
DESCRIPTION OF #1| ~ "CONVERSATIONS ABROAD"...A VISIT TO A TELEVISION
EXPOSITION AT LJUBUIANA UNIVERSITY IN YUGOSLAVIA,
AND AN INTERVIEW VittTH MEIVIBERS OF A STUDENT BAND PLAYING
AICERICAN MUSIC ~ SOUTH AMERICAN MAJilBO AND NORTH
AMERICAN JAZZ
Opens with recording of music (quality not exceptionally good, therefore much
of the musical portion already has been edited out) followed by an informal
and informative interview with members of the band (one spoke English well,
others were "fringe" participants with young English-speaking boy serving as
translator). Description of the instruments in the band, including the
national instrument, the accordian, and a review of what each of the players
was studying at the University; description of their TV exposition; review
of the college tuition system (free) under Socialism; the educational needs
of the country,. .what were the future plans of each student (each must spend
one year in military service) number of students in college in Yugoslavia,
location of other national colleges.
